newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: AutoEuropa to resume normal output.
newsitem.headline: AutoEuropa to resume normal output.

text.p: Portugal's biggest car manufacturer, the Ford-Volkswagen AutoEuropa joint venture, said it would resume normal production from Wednesday after a disruption caused by the 12-day French truckers' strike.
"Due to necessities related to stocks' logistics, AutoEuropa management decided that the plant is capable of restarting normal production on Wednesday, December 4," AutoEuropa said in a statement.

The AutoEuropa plant, 30 miles (50 km) south of Lisbon, which produces 510 passenger vans per day, halted production last Friday because the French truckers' strike last month had disrupted supplies to the plant.
